title: Data Structures: Stack
description: A Stack is a linear data structure that keeps its elements stacked on each other. It uses LIFO (last-in-first-out) ordering in which the last pushed item to the stack is processed first.

`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.pre,{children:(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.code,{className:"language-typescript:title=Stack.ts",children:`import { LinkedList } from '../LinkedList/LinkedList';

export class Stack<T> {
  private storage = new LinkedList<T>();

  public push(value: T): void {
    this.storage.append(value);
  }

  public pop(): T | null {
    return this.storage.deleteTail()?.value || null;
  }

  public isEmpty(): boolean {
    return !this.storage.getLast();
  }

  public peek(): T | null {
    return this.storage.getLast()?.value || null;
  }

  public toArray(): T[] {
    return this.storage.toArray();
  }

  public toString(callback?: (val: T) => string): string {
    return this.storage.toString(callback);
  }
}
`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/ross/Code/ugross.dev/content/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-032805fa-a2cd-4f88-9a8e-37ce0f6cdf9a.mdx",lineNumber:49,columnNumber:1},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/ross/Code/ugross.dev/content/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-032805fa-a2cd-4f88-9a8e-37ce0f6cdf9a.mdx",lineNumber:49,columnNumber:1},this),`
